hyper_text: Did You Know? Sudan Has More Pyramids Than Egypt
sidenote: The country has between 200 and 250 pyramids compared to Egypt’s roughly 138, making it the country with the most pyramids.

At a distance of 24.9 billion km from Earth as of May 2025, it is the most distant human-made object from Earth. Its radioisotope thermoelectric generators may supply enough electric power to return engineering data until 2036.

hyper_text: 7 Signs It's Time to Take Your Memory Problems Seriously

Treasure Island is the world's largest natural island in a lake on an island in a lake.

hyper_text: What you eat in midlife affects how healthy you are at age 70, according to a new study
sidenote: Eight diets are associated with healthy aging: the Alternative Healthy Eating Index (AHEI), the Alternative Mediterranean Index (aMED), the Dietary Approaches to Stop Hypertension (DASH), the Mediterranean-DASH Intervention for Neurodegenerative Delay (MIND), the healthful plant-based diet (hPDI), the Planetary Health Diet Index (PHDI), the empirically inflammatory dietary pattern (EDIP), and the empirical dietary index for hyperinsulinemia (EDIH).

sidenote:
"When prompted to adopt a humanlike persona,
GPT-4.5 was judged to be the human 73% of the time."

hyper_text: Alzheimer’s risk rises when amount of deep sleep falls, study suggests
sidenote: Deficits in slow-wave and REM sleep appear to shrink parts of the brain known to be early indicators of cognitive deterioration and Alzheimer’s disease.

hyper_text: How to Tell if an Elephant Is About to Get Violent
sidenote: According to Caitlin O’Connell-Rodwell, an instructor at Harvard Medical School who has been studying elephant communities and elephant societies for 30 years, the elephant behavior that’s making the news is quite bizarre.
